intro: Panax sessiliflorus, commonly known as the sessile-flower ginseng, is a rare and endangered plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain seeds, and it is known for its slow growth and long lifespan. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is critically endangered and protected in many regions.
